http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/scotland/4543274.stm
 
 The First Gay Civil Ceremony has taken place in Scotland, this follow the first ceremonies that had taken place on the 19th December in Northern Ireland.
 
 The couple where cheered when left the Registrars office, and there was no protests outside. Whereas in Northern Ireland, 40 people staged a protest.
 
 http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/northern_ireland/4540226.stm
 
 England and Wales will have their first ceremonies on the 21st of December.
 
 It is a great day for equality in the UK. emoticon_xgood
